page.title: 12Tourism in Hebden Bridge
page.content: Above Hebden Bridge is a village called{Heptonstall.}It is rather small but there are several reasons why people would go and stay there. There is an{Octagonal Methodist Church which is unique. John and Charles Wesley visited it, and it continues to be used as the village chapel. In the{graveyard}of the Heptonstall Parish Church is the ruin of the previous church, built in the 12th Century. Both old and new churches are dediated to St. Thomas a Becket. There are many interesting gravestones including those of 'King' David Hartley (hanged for coin forgery), the present Poet Laureate's first wife Sylvia Plath, and a man who was nagged to death by his wife. Heptonstall Grammar School closed in 1889 and os now a museum. A former pupil was the Earl of Stafford.
